body_html:
@asimshankar

Environment info

ubuntu 14.04 x86-64 on the VirtualBox.
I delete the Unity UI from OS for saving the system resource.
python version: python 2.7.6

A link to the pip package you installed:

https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

What other attempted solutions have you tried?

Firstly, I use pip to install the tensorflow.

sudo pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL

But it is very slow to download the package.
So I use another way to download the package from the site.
Then I cd to the directory of the package.
And I use the following command to install tensorflow,but IOError happen.

vagrant@data-science-toolbox:$ pwd
/home/vagrant
vagrant@data-science-toolbox:$ ls
book get-pip.py tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip
vagrant@data-science-toolbox:~$ sudo pip install tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip
Unpacking ./tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip
Running setup.py (path:/tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build/setup.py) egg_info for package from file:///home/vagrant/tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 17, in
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build/setup.py'
Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
Traceback (most recent call last):

File "", line 17, in

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build/setup.py'

Cleaning up...
Command python setup.py egg_info failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build
Storing debug log for failure in /home/vagrant/.pip/pip.log

body:
@asimshankar   

### Environment info

ubuntu 14.04  x86-64  on the VirtualBox. 
**I delete the Unity UI from OS for saving the system resource.**
python version: python 2.7.6

### A link to the pip package you installed:

https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/cpu/tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

### What other attempted solutions have you tried?

Firstly, I use pip to install the tensorflow. 

> sudo pip install --upgrade $TF_BINARY_URL

But it is very slow to download the  package.
So I use another way to download the package from the site.
Then I cd to the directory of the package.
And I use the following command to install tensorflow,but IOError happen.

> vagrant@data-science-toolbox:~$ pwd
> /home/vagrant
> vagrant@data-science-toolbox:~$ ls
> book  get-pip.py  tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip
> vagrant@data-science-toolbox:~$ **sudo pip install tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip**
> Unpacking ./tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip
>   Running setup.py (path:/tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build/setup.py) egg_info for package from file:///home/vagrant/tensorflow-0.11.0rc1-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.zip
>     Traceback (most recent call last):
>       File "<string>", line 17, in <module>
>     **IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build/setup.py'**
>     Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
>     Traceback (most recent call last):
> 
> File "<string>", line 17, in <module>
> 
> **IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build/setup.py'**
> 
> ----------------------------------------
> Cleaning up...
> Command python setup.py egg_info failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-w8yLzr-build
> Storing debug log for failure in /home/vagrant/.pip/pip.log
